div1.p: Gamery Park House New York 6th of Sept. 1858

Sir, On the eve of my departure from Bathrush, River Gambia, for this country for the benefit of my health,- I had the honor to receive your commerce rashion of the fifth- of May last informing me, that the President of the United States had seen fit to appoint me Com- mercial Agent for the United States at that port.

I most beg to reclose the official bond duty signed, sealed, and Bond vertified to, by the United States enclosed Attorney for the
To the Honorable Lewis Cap Secretary of State

I was born in Para, Brazit, and an the sow of Mr. Benjamin Upton, an American citizen, lately appointed Com- mercial Agent for Rosaire, Argentina Confederation, and have resided there years in Bathurst and received my appointment form the State of New York.

It is in my opinion necessary for the interests of the United States, that an evacuation be procured from the British Green -meerch; particularly as there has hitherto been no American Consulate represent a hive at that Colony.
I shall be ready to proceed when to my post, by the first conveyanace, which with he by a vessel of my own to sail in about three weeks.
It would be well to forward to new address in this city, the Books
for the same consequence as mother opportunity may not reoccur for some time.

The number of American vessels at Bathrust during the year is about thirty and I would respectfully submit to your consider- ation, whether to lase an American interest would not warrant the establishment of a consulate.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedt. + honorable servant, Daniel R.B. Upton
U.S. Commercial Agent
